de.hshl.obj.loader

Interface Resource.Environment

  • Enclosing class:
    Resource

    public static interface Resource.Environment
    A Environment represents a group of related files, for example a folder or a jar resource folder. Use it to specify the folder where your OBJ and MTL files reside in.
    Author:
    Johannes Vollmer
    See Also:
    Resource

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Resource.Environment folder(java.nio.file.Path folder)
      The Environment representing the specified directory.
      default java.nio.file.Path getFolderPath()
      If this Environment is made from a folder path, returns the path.
      static Resource.Environment local(java.nio.file.Path resourceFolder)
      The Environment representing the specified subdirectory in this JAR package or the IntelliJ resource folder.
      java.io.BufferedReader openResource(java.lang.String name)
      Open the specified resource inside this Resource.Environment

    • Method Detail

      • openResource

        java.io.BufferedReader openResource(java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Open the specified resource inside this Resource.Environment
        Parameters:
        name - Specified the resource to open
        Returns:
        The opened resource. Must be closed by the caller.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the resource cannot be opened

      • getFolderPath

        @Nullable
default java.nio.file.Path getFolderPath()
        If this Environment is made from a folder path, returns the path. Otherwise, returns null.

      • folder

        static Resource.Environment folder(@Nullable
                                   java.nio.file.Path folder)
        The Environment representing the specified directory. Only use this if your file is inside the "resource folder". Use local(Path) instead if possible.

      • local

        static Resource.Environment local(@Nullable
                                  java.nio.file.Path resourceFolder)
        The Environment representing the specified subdirectory in this JAR package or the IntelliJ resource folder.

        This method internally calls ClassLoader.getResourceAsStream(String).

        Read more about Resources to find out why this is useful.
        Parameters:
        resourceFolder - The sub-folder where the bundled resource is located, or null if the resource is in the root directory.
